definition: a representation usually on a flat surface of the whole or a part of an area
a representation of the celestial sphere or a part of it

a diagram or other visual representation that shows the relative position of the parts of something                                      
             
             Doctors use the images to construct a detailed three-dimensional map of the patient's brain …

something that represents with a clarity suggestive of a map                                      
             
             the Freudian map of the mind

the arrangement of genes on a chromosome                                      
                —      called also
        genetic map
function sense 5a
marked by a high degree of variation

in a position of prominence or fame                                      
             
             had put the fledgling university on the map

to make a map of                                      
             
             map the surface of the moon

to delineate as if on a map                                      
             
             sorrow was mapped on her face
to make a survey of for or as if for the purpose of making a map

to assign (something, such as a set or an element) in a mathematical or exact correspondence                                      
             
             map picture elements to video memory

to plan in detail                                      
                
                  —often used with out          map out a program
to locate (a gene) on a chromosome
to be located

to be assigned in a relation or connection                                      
             
             the major problems confronting humankind … do not map well onto the traditional disciplines
modified American plan
Walter circa 1140–circa 1209 English writer
a picture or chart that shows the rivers, mountains, streets, etc., in a particular area
a picture or chart that shows the different parts of something
to make a map of (something)
to plan the details of (something)

a picture or chart that shows the features of an area                                      
             
             a street map
a picture or chart of the sky showing the position of stars and planets

to make a map of                                      
             
             Astronomers are working to map the heavens.

to plan in detail                                      
             
             …I had not mapped out a scheme for determining the merits of officers…

to locate (a gene) on a chromosome                                      
             
             mutants which have been genetically mapped

to be located                                      
             
             a repressor maps near the corresponding structural gene

definition: an image of an area that shows the positions of things such as countries, rivers, cities, and streets
used about other types of images that show the positions of things
in: map of: a map of northern Europe/the London Underground/New York City
read a map  (=understand what a map shows): They never taught us how to read a map at school.
study a map  (=look carefully at a map): Juliet was studying the map to decide which route to take.
a map of the human brain
off the map
put someone/something on the map

definition: a drawing of the earth's surface, or part of that surface, showing the shape and position of different countries, political borders, natural features such as rivers and mountains, and artificial features such as roads and buildings:
a drawing that gives you a particular type of information about a particular area:
something that shows the position of stars in the sky or the features on the surface of planets:
a very simple drawing that shows a direction of travel between one place and another:
to represent an area of land in the form of a map:

a drawing that represents a region or place by showing the various features of it, such as rivers and roads, and the distances between them, so that people can get help in finding their way from one place to another:
to draw a representation of a place:
a drawing of the Earth's surface, or part of it, showing things such as the shape and position of countries, political borders, towns, rivers, etc.:
a simple plan that shows a direction of travel between one place and another:
a simple plan that represents a more complicated thing, system, or idea:
to make a person, place, or thing well known or show how important it is:
to show how something is put together or organized:

a map of Paris

definition: MAP stands for Masquerading Asshole Pedophile. It’s a new term pedophiles came up with to protect pedophiles from being identified as pedophiles. They claim it stands for Minor Attracted Person, but really it’s a sham of language. They use the word “minor” because it can evoke the image of a 17 year old when really they are talking about 4 year olds. They use the word “attracted” because it implies they might not act on it, but then they believe children can give consent (which would mean acting on it wouldn’t be immoral and thus they definitely WOULD act on it). Lastly, the biggest deception is using the word Person when they’re not really people, they’re pedophiles. It’s also not a coincidence it spells out MAP which is an innocuous, useful every day item when they are in fact the opposite of all those things (dangerous, useless, and a tiny disgusting subset of the population). It is a prime example of conflation, obfuscation, and Orwellian language .

Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
